<details><summary>Solution A</summary>

$$
Risk_{exposed} = \frac{200}{560} = 0.36
$$

$$
Risk_{unexposed} = \frac{175}{940} = 0.19
$$ 

$$
RR = \frac{0.33}{0.12} = 1.89
$$

<details><summary>Solution B</summary>

$$
Odds_{case} = \frac{200}{175} = 1.14
$$

$$
Odds_{control} = \frac{360}{765} = 0.47
$$ 

$$
OR = \frac{1.67}{0.45} = 2.42
$$ 

__Interpretation:__ The odds of practicing physical activity among cases is 2.42 times as high as the odd of practicing physical activity among the controls.
